title: A neat idea for the next time you play urf
body: Maybe try someone other than Hec, Nid, Shaco, Sona, Blitz, Zed, Fizz, Azir, Wukong *deep breath* Ez, Skarner or Maokai.  Believe it or not, a bunch of other champs exist and are fun to play.  On top of that, you might get to play games where the deciding factor isn't who picked the most OP unbanned champs, which is pretty fun.

replies.body: That why this mode isn't permanent! Can you image how stale it would get months afterwards and still seeing the same champs over and over and over again! Don't get me wrong I try to enjoy the mode. And while I will use any champs I like to play. Seeing the same champs just gets boring. It's come to point now where I'll only play it if friends play because I can tell when I play with all random people it's the usually pick/bans!
I can imagine it perfectly fine, it'd be just like normal games.

I'm probably one of the only people I've seen that actually play Diana {{champion:131}}  in URF.
Like, seriously. She's OP as Hell. Why hasn't anyone else tried using her? 
Oh, right. She's often overlooked. All the time.
Yaaas, love Diana.

She's so much fun in URF. Even in normals. <3

I just love it when people choose Katarina, thinking they're gonna go God-Mode on everyone.
Then, bam, Diana! 
MY LANE--
I haven't used one of those yet. I make it a point not to do that, because playing the flavor-of-the-month habitually makes a game stale pretty quickly. Would be nice if others did the same.

That.


I missed URF last year and I gotta say that the novelty of this year wore off pretty quick.
It gets really lame seeing the same champs banned/picked over and over again.
{{champion:103}} {{champion:1}} {{champion:117}} are pretty good if you're skilled in urf, believe it or not :) I had a lot of fun playing Annie

I've played half of those, but only once each. My other 30 or so games have also involved playing entirely different champions every single game. Picking a main for URF is no fun, it's much better to try everything and see what happens.

I ran into a team comp the other day that was J-4, Alister, Maokai, Cho'Gath, and I forget their 5th.
Every team fight: permanently knocked-up. Everyone. It was horrible.
(Knock-ups aren't affected by tenacity either. So our Irelia was equally helpless.)

Still. This is the kind of experimentation I like to see in URF.

Only one I played from that list was Wukong one time, and when I did I went 15/5. After realizing how stupid he is on urf mode, it just wasn't even fun to play him so I stopped playing him. Personally I like champions like Talon, Ahri, Diana, and Anivia in this mode and seems I find the most success and fun when playing Diana lol
Have you tried Talon in URF? He's nearly broken past level 6.
I had a ton of fun with Nautilus, Rammus, Galio and Vel'Koz
You only need the dunker, the rest of the champions are just fodder for pentas, anyone that gets close dies, those who dont {{item:3280}} {{item:3140}} {{item:3142}} rip.

Yeah, here's the thing.  Those ones you listed?  They're not the most OP.  They just somehow became meta picks.

I'll show you OP.

{{champion:12}} {{champion:103}} {{champion:89}} {{champion:82}} {{champion:34}} {{champion:1}} {{champion:31}} {{champion:8}} 

And I have barely even tried 1/8 of the champion pool so far.

Also {{champion:90}}, as stated, is a well-known and overpicked OP along with {{champion:6}} (tho 99% of people who pick them don't know how to build them).




Here's the other thing.

Items.

URF players are stupid, and their idea of "OP" is "I can't counter dis guy while building irrelevant glass cannon trash"

Here's a little gem for you: {{item:3364}}.
Those annoying stealth champions?  Yeah, this thing in URF gives you 10 seconds of true sight on a 15 second cooldown.
Enemy has no stealth? {{item:3363}}.  Yellow sucks on URF.  You need to be mobile.  Riot overbuffed this from last year, when it was already amazing.  Now it can provide persistent vision for you on a tiny clairvoyance cooldown.  Scout ahead for free, check all bushes from massive range.  The only thing you miss out on is teleport targets, but you can carry a normal ward for when your teammates ask for one to go in on.

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/GD/l3axGYl1-the-real-urf-ops I list a bunch more.  Seriously guys, stop overpicking boring champs, and start using your brains for SIMPLE ways to actually win.

{{champion:69}} {{champion:131}} {{champion:89}} {{champion:90}} {{champion:61}} {{champion:91}} {{champion:77}} {{champion:8}}

Some of the most fun champs this URF. Underused, as well. And I have to say, Varus is just stupidly OP in this. That Q spam is ridiculous with the way the cooldown works now.

> [{quoted}](name=Levyathyn,realm=NA,application-id=LFfTlAky,discussion-id=UXyHMgrH,comment-id=000e,timestamp=2015-04-05T19:36:57.881+0000)
>
> {{champion:69}} {{champion:131}} {{champion:89}} {{champion:90}} {{champion:61}} {{champion:91}} {{champion:77}} {{champion:8}}
> 
> Some of the most fun champs this URF. Underused, as well. And I have to say, Varus is just stupidly OP in this. That Q spam is ridiculous with the way the cooldown works now.

Vladimir is in no way underused...
Ah, my bad then. I've only seen him once, and been him once. I'd have probably used him more myself, but I don't have Soulstealer until it goes on sale. =\
I got called no-skill OP by an ezreal and a yi yesterday on syndra, after i hit 5 consecutive stuns on yi coming out of alpha strike. it was hilarious.
{{champion:134}} + {{item:3042}} + Max amount of Dark Spheres = Death
Does it proc on that?
When you ult it procs on each sphere
Huh. i thought that only procced on AA's. although, is it worth the AP loss?
Auto-Attacks and Single Target Spells. And yeah, but only for the ult
Have you seen any numbers on if it's better for just the ult to get {{item:3042}} over {{item:3040}}? because the pure AP versus the extra power on each hit would be an interesting consideration.

I had it calculated out before but don't remember the numbers. Basically if you have a halfway decent amount of mana your ult will do a ton of damage since each sphere procs the passive and if you have a few spheres it does a ton

You can always do both. 
I know that i do that while playing {{champion:13}}. You just gotta let one of them transform before you get another {{item:3070}}, so you can start getting stacks again. at that point, you have a massive mana pool and get a large boost to your ap and your ad. 
Only problem is that this can take a VERY long time to do, since you need 750 stacks for each, but if you get {{item:3043}} first, you can quickly stack up {{item:3003}}, since it gets stacks faster. 
worth it in the long run, but not if the match is gonna end quickly (i haven't gotten both up at the same time very often, the match usually ends before i complete the second one on normal games)
Yeah doing both makes the damage insane especially on Ryze with {{item:3027}} and {{item:3025}} / {{item:3110}}
The holiest of shits.

garen perma silence op

and executing people left and right
i play ad bard. too much fun
{{champion:98}} any enemy champ without tenacity has a .1 second to react

Part of the fun is taking a different champion and making them work vs the above. 

Bard and Yasou are really the only two useless champions in URF. To an extent Thresh unless you have a team that can work well with him.
Bard's alright, though. if you can catch someone near a wall you can perma-stun with Q.
It's so hard to die in urf with Bard lel, you can juke for dayz with the magical journey ,and you can heal yourself while also getting ms
{{champion:122}} I dunked bitches.
{{champion:29}} is fun. Near perma stealth and towers crumble lmao not to mention you get 2-3 e's on people trying to run from you after q>w>r
You forgot to include {{champion:11}}  and {{champion:28}}  in your list...
VEL KOZ IS GOD D:
